title: Cu recovery - error to explain higher mass of Cu

content.description: The mass of the Cu(s) produced in step 3 was slightly more than the mass predicted from the
content.question: 3.8 g of Cu3(PO4)2(s) recovered from step 1. Which of the following could account for thediscrepancy in the yield of Cu(s) from step 3 ?

choices.label: All of the Cu3(PO4)2(s) dissolved in the HCl(aq).
Some of the Cu(s) adhered to the side of the funnel used to filter the solution.
Some unreacted Zn(s) was mixed in with the Cu(s).
Too much Na3PO4(aq) was added to the original Cu2+(aq) solution.

content.answer: Some unreacted Zn(s) was mixed in with the Cu(s).

skill.text: 6.G: Explain how potential sources of experimental error may affect the experimental results.
